Class Board

  • java.lang.Object
    • player.Board
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    public class Board
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    A single player's board to play the game on
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Alessandro
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      Board​(int gridSize)
      Constructs a board with grids of the specified size.

    • Method Summary

      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void displayShipGrid()
      Displays the ship grid of the board with any received damage.
      void displayShotGrid()
      Displays the shot grid of the board.

      Fires a shot at the specified coordinate on the ship grid, then records the result in the received shot grid and returns it.
      int getGridSize()
      Returns the size of the grids that make up this board.
      ShotResults getReceivedAt​(Coordinate c)
      Returns the result of the received shot at the specified coordinate, or null if no such shot has been taken.
      ShotResults getResultAt​(Coordinate c)
      Returns the result of the shot at the specified coordinate, or null if no such shot has been taken.
      int getShipCount()
      Returns the amount of tiles occupied by ships on this board.
      boolean isOutside​(int x, int y)  
      boolean isShipAt​(Coordinate c)
      Returns whether there is a ship at the specified coordinate.
      boolean placeShip​(Coordinate c, Directions dir, int length)
      Attempts to position a ship on the board.
      void setReceivedAt​(Coordinate c, ShotResults result)
      Sets the cell at the specified coordinate in the received shots grid to the specified result.
      void setResultsAt​(Coordinate c, ShotResults result)
      Sets the cell at the specified coordinate in the result grid to the specified result.

    • Method Detail

      • isShipAt

        public boolean isShipAt​(Coordinate c)
        Returns whether there is a ship at the specified coordinate.
        Parameters:
        c - the coordinate to check.
        Returns:
        true if there is a ship, false otherwise.

      • getGridSize

        public int getGridSize()
        Returns the size of the grids that make up this board.
        Returns:
        the grid size.

      • fireShotAt

        public ShotResults fireShotAt​(Coordinate c)
        Fires a shot at the specified coordinate on the ship grid, then records the result in the received shot grid and returns it.
        Parameters:
        c - the coordinate to fire at.
        Returns:
        ShotResults.HIT if the shot hit, ShotResults.MISS if it didn't and ShotResults.SINK if it sinked the ship it hit.

      • getResultAt

        public ShotResults getResultAt​(Coordinate c)
        Returns the result of the shot at the specified coordinate, or null if no such shot has been taken.
        Parameters:
        c - the coordinate.
        Returns:
        the result of the shot, or null if no such shot has been taken.

      • setResultsAt

        public void setResultsAt​(Coordinate c,
                         ShotResults result)
        Sets the cell at the specified coordinate in the result grid to the specified result.
        Parameters:
        c - the coordinate to update.
        result - the result to set.

      • getReceivedAt

        public ShotResults getReceivedAt​(Coordinate c)
        Returns the result of the received shot at the specified coordinate, or null if no such shot has been taken.
        Parameters:
        c - the coordinate.
        Returns:
        the result of the shot, or null if no such shot has been taken.

      • setReceivedAt

        public void setReceivedAt​(Coordinate c,
                          ShotResults result)
        Sets the cell at the specified coordinate in the received shots grid to the specified result.
        Parameters:
        c - the coordinate to update.
        result - the result to set.

      • getShipCount

        public int getShipCount()
        Returns the amount of tiles occupied by ships on this board.
        Returns:
        the ship count.

      • isOutside

        public boolean isOutside​(int x,
                         int y)

      • placeShip

        public boolean placeShip​(Coordinate c,
                         Directions dir,
                         int length)
        Attempts to position a ship on the board. Will fail if the specified ship extends out of bounds or overlaps with the bounding box of an existing ship. If this method fails, the board will not be changed.
        Parameters:
        c - the coordinate of the first cell of the ship.
        dir - the direction the ship extends in.
        length - the length of the ship.
        Returns:
        true if the ship could be placed, false otherwise.

      • displayShipGrid

        public void displayShipGrid()
        Displays the ship grid of the board with any received damage.

      • displayShotGrid

        public void displayShotGrid()
        Displays the shot grid of the board.
